verses.roman:
vṛko nāmāsuraḥ putraḥ
śakuneḥ pathi nāradam
dṛṣṭvāśu-toṣaṁ papraccha
deveṣu triṣu durmatiḥ

synonyms: vṛkaḥ—Vṛka; nāma—by name; asuraḥ—a demon; putraḥ—a son; śakuneḥ—of Śakuni; pathi—on the road; nāradam—the sage Nārada; dṛṣṭvā—seeing; āśu—quickly; toṣam—pleased; papraccha—he asked about; deveṣu—among the lords; triṣu—three; durmatiḥ—wicked.
translation: The demon named Vṛka, a son of Śakuni's, once met Nārada on the road. The wicked fellow asked him which of the three chief gods could be pleased most quickly.
